documentation.text: @dev Collection of functions related to array types.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256[] storage pointer,uint256) pure returns (struct StorageSlot.Uint256Slot storage pointer)
function (uint256[] storage pointer,uint256) pure returns (struct StorageSlot.Uint256Slot storage pointer)

documentation.text:
@dev Searches a sorted `array` and returns the first index that contains
 a value greater or equal to `element`. If no such index exists (i.e. all
 values in the array are strictly less than `element`), the array length is
 returned. Time complexity O(log n).
 `array` is expected to be sorted in ascending order, and to contain no
 repeated elements.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes32) pure returns (struct StorageSlot.AddressSlot storage pointer)

documentation.text:
@dev Access an array in an "unsafe" way. Skips solidity "index-out-of-range" check.
 WARNING: Only use if you are certain `pos` is lower than the array length.
